news.title: Airport Issues Warning Due to Adverse Weather
news.excerpt: The airport issued a warning about expected windy weather that may affect air travel. Passengers are advised to check their flight status before departure.
content: The airport has issued a warning due to expected adverse weather conditions that may impact air travel.
According to meteorological forecasts, strong winds are expected, particularly in the eastern and western parts of the island, as well as in the Porto Santo area.
Wind speeds may reach up to 70 km/h, which could cause delays or flight cancellations.
The airport is asking passengers to check the current status of their flights before departure.
The news was originally reported in the Madeira press.

news.title: Missing Tourist Found Safe in Curral das Freiras Area
news.excerpt: A Belgian tourist was searched for in the Curral das Freiras area after disappearing on a hiking trail. The man was eventually found safe and did not require medical assistance.
content: A Belgian tourist was searched for in the Curral das Freiras area after disappearing during a hike.
The search began in the afternoon, involving five firefighters and two vehicles from the Câmara de Lobos volunteer unit.
The 46-year-old man was found in the evening, unharmed and without the need for medical assistance.
Local forestry staff also participated in the search.
The news was originally reported in the Madeira press.

news.title: Visitor Stuck Mid-Air in Ribeira da Janela Area
news.excerpt: A visitor stopped in the middle of the zipline in Ribeira da Janela and was left suspended in mid-air. The staff safely rescued the person, and no injuries occurred.
content: A visitor stopped in the middle of the zipline between Ribeira da Janela and Fajã de Barro, remaining suspended in mid-air.
One of the staff members reached the stranded person and safely guided them back to the starting point.
The rescue was carried out quickly and professionally, with no injuries reported.
The zipline is a popular adventure activity, and according to the operators, such incidents are rare, but the staff is prepared for all situations.
The news was originally reported in the Madeira press.

news.title: Tourist Injured at Ponta do Rosto Viewpoint
news.excerpt: An Irish tourist was injured at the Ponta do Rosto viewpoint after falling on a difficult section. Paramedics treated her on site before transporting her to hospital.
content: An Irish tourist was injured at the Ponta do Rosto viewpoint after falling on a rocky, difficult section.
The woman suffered a leg injury; paramedics treated her at the scene before transporting her to a medical facility.
The area around the viewpoint is a popular hiking destination, but some parts of the terrain can be dangerous, especially in windy conditions.
Authorities are urging visitors to exercise extra caution when walking along hiking trails.
The news was originally reported in the Madeira press.

news.title: Body Found in Canhas Area – Police Rule Out Crime
news.excerpt: A man’s body was discovered in the Canhas area near Ponta do Sol. Authorities believe the body had been there for about two weeks. Police ruled out foul play.
content: In early June, a man’s body was found in a hard-to-reach area of Canhas, near Ponta do Sol.
The body was discovered by a passerby who immediately alerted the authorities. Police and forensic technicians arrived at the scene.
Based on the condition of the body, experts believe the deceased had been at the site for at least 15 days.
The on-site investigation found no evidence of foul play. Police officially ruled out the possibility of a crime.
The man’s identity was later confirmed, and authorities notified his relatives.
The circumstances of the death are still under investigation, but current information does not suggest criminal involvement.
The news was originally reported in the Madeira press.

news.title: Tourist Rescued from Levada do Ribeiro Frio Trail
news.excerpt: A tourist around 60 years old suffered an accident on July 4 along the Levada do Ribeiro Frio near Posto Florestal. He had to be rescued by mountain rescuers due to back pain.
content: On Friday, an older man fell while hiking along a section of the Levada do Ribeiro Frio, not far from the Posto Florestal building.
The tourist fell from his own height and, due to back pain, was unable to continue his hike.
Following the accident, the Machico municipal fire department’s mountain rescue unit was alerted and quickly arrived at the scene.
The rescue team provided first aid to the man and then began transporting him to the nearest accessible road.
There, an ambulance was waiting to take him to the emergency department of Dr. Nélio Mendonça Hospital for further examination.
The rescue was carried out in a coordinated manner, ensuring that the tourist received timely medical care.
The news was originally reported in the Madeira press.

news.title: French Tourist Injured in Jet-Ski Accident Near Cais 8
news.excerpt: A 25-year-old French citizen was injured on July 4 in the waters off Cais 8 in Funchal while riding a jet ski. He was taken to hospital with a leg injury.
content: On Friday afternoon, a French tourist was involved in a jet-ski accident in the waters between Cais 8 and Praça do Povo, near Funchal.
The 25-year-old man reportedly collided with another jet ski, injuring his left leg in the accident.
Despite the injury, he managed to return to shore, where he called for help via the 112 emergency line.
An emergency unit from the Cruz Vermelha Portuguesa (Portuguese Red Cross) arrived at Cais 8 and provided first aid to the man.
He was then transported by ambulance to the emergency department of Dr. Nélio Mendonça Hospital, where his leg injury was treated.
According to hospital sources, the tourist’s condition was stable, and he was expected to be discharged later that evening.
The news was originally reported in the Madeira press.

news.title: Passengers Complain About Airline’s Attitude After Flight Diverted to Porto Santo
news.excerpt: A Ryanair flight originally bound for Funchal was forced to land in Porto Santo on June 2 due to strong winds. Passengers complained about the airline’s indifferent attitude.
content: On June 2, a Ryanair flight operating on the Porto–Funchal route was unable to land in Madeira due to strong winds and was diverted to Porto Santo airport.
The plane arrived in Porto Santo after midnight, where passengers, following a long wait, realized that the airline was not providing adequate assistance.
One passenger traveling with a minor child reported that they received neither food nor water, and the little water offered came from the restroom, poured into cups.
In a message, the airline stated that it could not provide accommodation and asked passengers to find lodging themselves, promising reimbursement later.
Since nearly all accommodations on the island were fully booked, many passengers were forced to sleep on the airport floor, where staff provided mattresses, blankets, and pillows.
Passengers highlighted that airport staff and police behaved helpfully, while they felt no meaningful support from the airline.
The news was originally reported in the Madeira press.

news.title: Sixteen People Rescued from the Sea in Madeira During First Half of the Year
news.excerpt: The Funchal maritime rescue center carried out 23 operations in the first six months of 2025, rescuing a total of 16 people from the sea around Madeira.
content: According to the Portuguese Navy, the Funchal Maritime Search and Rescue Coordination Center (MRSC Funchal) directed 23 rescue operations between January and June in the region.
During these operations, a total of 16 people were rescued from the sea after facing various emergencies in coastal waters.

The successful interventions were made possible thanks to the cooperation of several organizations, including the navy, the National Maritime Authority, the Portuguese Air Force, and emergency medical services.
The INEM maritime emergency center (CODU-MAR) played a key role, along with regional and national civil protection, fire departments, and port authorities.
At the national level, the Lisbon rescue center handled 149 maritime incidents, while the Ponta Delgada center coordinated 76 cases, assisting more than 200 additional people.
Authorities emphasize that prevention and rapid alert are crucial for effectively managing maritime accidents.
The news was originally reported in the Madeira press.

news.title: Strong Winds Cause 14 Flight Cancellations at Madeira Airport
news.excerpt: On Tuesday, July 1, fourteen flights were canceled at Madeira International Airport due to strong winds. Another twelve planes were forced to land at alternative airports.
content: On Tuesday, operations at Madeira International Airport were significantly affected by strong winds, leading to multiple flight cancellations and diversions.
A total of 14 flights were canceled, including those bound for Wrocław, Warsaw, Katowice, Poznań, Gran Canaria, Lisbon, Bilbao, and Madrid.
In addition to the cancellations, 12 aircraft were unable to land in Madeira and were diverted to alternative airports such as Porto Santo, Tenerife, Lisbon, or Faro.
According to the meteorological station, the strongest gusts reached 73 km/h, making safe landings and takeoffs extremely difficult.
The airport operator urged passengers to check the status of their flights before departure, as adverse weather conditions may persist.
The news was originally reported in the Madeira press.

news.title: Passengers from Madeira Waited Three Hours for Luggage in Lisbon
news.excerpt: On July 1, passengers arriving in Lisbon from Madeira had to wait nearly three hours for their luggage. The delay caused confusion and dissatisfaction among travelers.
content: A TAP flight, originally scheduled to depart Madeira at 9:50 p.m., took off more than an hour late due to weather conditions.
After the plane landed, passengers received no information about their luggage for a long time and waited more than an hour and a half without updates.
Eventually, after several complaints, it was revealed that the baggage had been left in the airport’s external area, in the aircraft parking zone.
The total waiting time reached three hours, which many found frustrating and unacceptable, especially families with children and elderly passengers.
One passenger ironically remarked: “It’s faster to get from Madeira to Lisbon than to find your luggage at the capital’s airport.”
The news was originally reported in the Madeira press.
